content:
ILeaseManager ILeaseManager Interface

In this Article

Edit

If you wish to have EventProcessorHost store leases somewhere other than Azure Storage, you can write your own lease manager using this interface.

The Azure Storage managers use the same storage for both lease and checkpoints, so both interfaces are implemented by the same class. You are free to do the same thing if you have a unified store for both types of data.

This interface does not specify initialization methods because we have no way of knowing what information your implementation will require.

Syntax

Declaration

public interface ILeaseManagerPublic Interface ILeaseManager

Properties summary

LeaseDuration
LeaseDuration

Mostly useful for testing.
LeaseRenewInterval
LeaseRenewInterval

Allows a lease manager implementation to specify to PartitionManager how often it should scan leases and renew them. In order to redistribute leases in a timely fashion after a host ceases operating, we recommend a relatively short interval, such as ten seconds. Obviously it should be less than half of the lease length, to prevent accidental expiration.

Methods summary

AcquireLeaseAsync(Lease)
AcquireLeaseAsync(Lease)

Acquire the lease on the desired partition for this EventProcessorHost.

Note that it is legal to acquire a lease that is already owned by another host. Lease-stealing is how partitions are redistributed when additional hosts are started.
CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(String)
CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(String)

Create in the store the lease info for the given partition, if it does not exist. Do nothing if it does exist in the store already.

CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync()
CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync()

Create the lease store if it does not exist, do nothing if it does exist.
DeleteLeaseAsync(Lease)
DeleteLeaseAsync(Lease)

Delete the lease info for the given partition from the store. If there is no stored lease for the given partition, that is treated as success.
DeleteLeaseStoreAsync()
DeleteLeaseStoreAsync()

Not used by EventProcessorHost, but a convenient function to have for testing.
GetAllLeases()
GetAllLeases()

Return the lease info for all partitions. A typical implementation could just call GetLeaseAsync() on all partitions.
GetLeaseAsync(String)
GetLeaseAsync(String)

Return the lease info for the specified partition. Can return null if no lease has been created in the store for the specified partition.
LeaseStoreExistsAsync()
LeaseStoreExistsAsync()

Does the lease store exist?
ReleaseLeaseAsync(Lease)
ReleaseLeaseAsync(Lease)

Give up a lease currently held by this host.

If the lease has been stolen, or expired, releasing it is unnecessary, and will fail if attempted.
RenewLeaseAsync(Lease)
RenewLeaseAsync(Lease)

Renew a lease currently held by this host.

If the lease has been stolen, or expired, or released, it is not possible to renew it. You will have to call getLease() and then acquireLease() again.
UpdateLeaseAsync(Lease)
UpdateLeaseAsync(Lease)

Update the store with the information in the provided lease.

It is necessary to currently hold a lease in order to update it. If the lease has been stolen, or expired, or released, it cannot be updated. Updating should renew the lease before performing the update to avoid lease expiration during the process.

Properties

  • Edit
    LeaseDuration
    LeaseDuration

    Mostly useful for testing.

    TimeSpan LeaseDuration { get; }ReadOnly Property LeaseDuration As TimeSpan

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan
      TimeSpan

      Duration of a lease before it expires unless renewed.

  • Edit
    LeaseRenewInterval
    LeaseRenewInterval

    Allows a lease manager implementation to specify to PartitionManager how often it should scan leases and renew them. In order to redistribute leases in a timely fashion after a host ceases operating, we recommend a relatively short interval, such as ten seconds. Obviously it should be less than half of the lease length, to prevent accidental expiration.

    TimeSpan LeaseRenewInterval { get; }ReadOnly Property LeaseRenewInterval As TimeSpan

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan
      TimeSpan

      The sleep interval between scans

Methods

  • Edit
    AcquireLeaseAsync(Lease)
    AcquireLeaseAsync(Lease)

    Acquire the lease on the desired partition for this EventProcessorHost.

    Note that it is legal to acquire a lease that is already owned by another host. Lease-stealing is how partitions are redistributed when additional hosts are started.

    Task<bool> AcquireLeaseAsync(Lease lease)Function AcquireLeaseAsync(lease As Lease) As Task(Of Boolean)

    Parameters

    • lease
      Lease
      Lease

      Lease info for the desired partition as previously obtained from GetLeaseAsync()

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the lease was acquired successfully, false if not

  • Edit
    CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(String)
    CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(String)

    Create in the store the lease info for the given partition, if it does not exist. Do nothing if it does exist in the store already. 

    Task<Lease> CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(string partitionId)Function CreateLeaseIfNotExistsAsync(partitionId As String) As Task(Of Lease)

    Parameters

    • partitionId
      String
      String

      id of partition to create lease info for

    Returns

    • Task<Lease>
      Task(Of Lease)

      the existing or newly-created lease info for the partition

  • Edit
    CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync()
    CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync()

    Create the lease store if it does not exist, do nothing if it does exist.

    Task<bool> CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync()Function CreateLeaseStoreIfNotExistsAsync As Task(Of Boolean)

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the lease store already exists or was created successfully, false if not

  • Edit
    DeleteLeaseAsync(Lease)
    DeleteLeaseAsync(Lease)

    Delete the lease info for the given partition from the store. If there is no stored lease for the given partition, that is treated as success.

    Task DeleteLeaseAsync(Lease lease)Function DeleteLeaseAsync(lease As Lease) As Task

    Parameters

    • lease
      Lease
      Lease

      Lease info for the desired partition as previously obtained from GetLeaseAsync()

    Returns

    • Task
      Task
  • Edit
    DeleteLeaseStoreAsync()
    DeleteLeaseStoreAsync()

    Not used by EventProcessorHost, but a convenient function to have for testing.

    Task<bool> DeleteLeaseStoreAsync()Function DeleteLeaseStoreAsync As Task(Of Boolean)

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the lease store was deleted successfully, false if not

  • Edit
    GetAllLeases()
    GetAllLeases()

    Return the lease info for all partitions. A typical implementation could just call GetLeaseAsync() on all partitions.

    IEnumerable<Task<Lease>> GetAllLeases()Function GetAllLeases As IEnumerable(Of Task(Of Lease))

    Returns

    • IEnumerable<Task<Lease>>
      IEnumerable(Of Task(Of Lease))

      list of lease info.

  • Edit
    GetLeaseAsync(String)
    GetLeaseAsync(String)

    Return the lease info for the specified partition. Can return null if no lease has been created in the store for the specified partition.

    Task<Lease> GetLeaseAsync(string partitionId)Function GetLeaseAsync(partitionId As String) As Task(Of Lease)

    Parameters

    • partitionId
      String
      String

      id of partition to get lease for

    Returns

    • Task<Lease>
      Task(Of Lease)

      lease info for the partition, or null

  • Edit
    LeaseStoreExistsAsync()
    LeaseStoreExistsAsync()

    Does the lease store exist?

    Task<bool> LeaseStoreExistsAsync()Function LeaseStoreExistsAsync As Task(Of Boolean)

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)
  • Edit
    ReleaseLeaseAsync(Lease)
    ReleaseLeaseAsync(Lease)

    Give up a lease currently held by this host.

    If the lease has been stolen, or expired, releasing it is unnecessary, and will fail if attempted.

    Task<bool> ReleaseLeaseAsync(Lease lease)Function ReleaseLeaseAsync(lease As Lease) As Task(Of Boolean)

    Parameters

    • lease
      Lease
      Lease

      Lease to be given up

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the lease was released successfully, false if not

  • Edit
    RenewLeaseAsync(Lease)
    RenewLeaseAsync(Lease)

    Renew a lease currently held by this host.

    If the lease has been stolen, or expired, or released, it is not possible to renew it. You will have to call getLease() and then acquireLease() again.

    Task<bool> RenewLeaseAsync(Lease lease)Function RenewLeaseAsync(lease As Lease) As Task(Of Boolean)

    Parameters

    • lease
      Lease
      Lease

      Lease to be renewed

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the lease was renewed successfully, false if not

  • Edit
    UpdateLeaseAsync(Lease)
    UpdateLeaseAsync(Lease)

    Update the store with the information in the provided lease.

    It is necessary to currently hold a lease in order to update it. If the lease has been stolen, or expired, or released, it cannot be updated. Updating should renew the lease before performing the update to avoid lease expiration during the process.

    Task<bool> UpdateLeaseAsync(Lease lease)Function UpdateLeaseAsync(lease As Lease) As Task(Of Boolean)

    Parameters

    • lease
      Lease
      Lease

      New lease info to be stored

    Returns

    • Task<Boolean>
      Task(Of Boolean)

      true if the updated was performed successfully, false if not
